title: This is the absolute worst candy to give out on Halloween
text:
Keep the candy corn.

While Halloween Eve may be National Candy Corn Day, the households that hand out those tri-color sugar kernels are as despised as the ones that give raisins, pennies or toothbrushes, according to CandyStore.com.

The sweets seller studied several best and worst Halloween candy lists from BuzzFeed, HuffPo and Fox News, and surveyed 30,000 of its own customers to come up with their own definitive Halloween treat ranking.

And generic candy corn took the “worst” spot from circus peanuts, the spongy, banana-flavored marshmallow candies that have been the most hated on CandyStore.com’s list for the past few years.

The faux peanuts took the second spot this time around, with peanut butter kisses (aka Necco’s Mary Jane pieces, and not a delicious mix of Hershey’s HSY, +1.62% Kisses or the chocolate company’s Reese’s Peanut Butter Cups) being branded the third worst candy.

Other treats considered tricks include wax cola bottles, Necco Wafers, Tootsie Rolls TR, +0.47%, Good & Plenty licorice candy and Bit-O-Honey taffies. Check out the full list below.

So which goodies will make you the best house on the block? CandyStore.com also drew up a map of which candies are the most popular by state. And Skittles from Mars Inc. were named America’s favorite overall, taking the top spot in places like California, Florida and South Carolina, followed by Reese’s Peanut Butter Cups and M&Ms.

CandyStore.com

Most Americans (95%) celebrating Halloween will be buying candy this year, according to the National Retail Federation, spending a jaw-dropping $2.6 billion on the treats.
description: A couple of surveys rank the goodies that trick-or-treaters aren’t sweet on — and the ones they love.
